column4: hello, I got a laptop "acer aspire" with 4GB of ram, but my system see's only 3Gb any clues/ideas?
You need to use either the 64 bit version of Ubuntu or the server kernel
tried too but for some odd reason it refused to install
Is it a 64 bit CPU?
nope an i686 dual-core
http://tinyurl.com/yg47ety
Did it come with 4 GIG of RAM? It would be interesting if it did considering AFAIK windows can't access 4 gig of ram with it's 32 bit version, though linux can :)
it came with Vista 64-bit pre installed
I thought you said it was a 32 bit processor?
What problem did you have installing 64 bit Ubuntu?
well I never got pass the inital installing fhase
Stops where? Does the LiveCD boot to a desktop?
nope it do not
Did it give any error message?
perhaps there is something not right with my burned cd's, I do not know
Did you try the self test of the CD at boot?
nope, I did not
Of the CD or just the iso file?
the Isos
Check the CD
well do
do I need to pay attention to anything else?
Make sure you are using the latest version of Ubuntu ( 9.04 ) or the latest long term support release ( 8.04 )
hello, I guess I figured out what's the issue with the processor issue I asked couple of days ago
